intro: Cydonia oblonga, commonly known as the quince, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It produces a fragrant, yellow-orange fruit that is typically harvested when it is still hard and unripe. The fruit contains a hard, woody core surrounded by a thick, aromatic pulp. The plant has pale green, ovate leaves and produces small, white flowers in the spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as for its edible fruit.
